'Faced with Trump and an out-of-touch Democratic leadership, a left-wing surge is taking hold in the US'
subhead: On June 24, Zohran Mamdani, a member of the Democratic Party's left wing, won the party's nomination for mayor of New York City. While his path to victory will likely be difficult, academic Mathieu Bonzom argues in his column that the rise of the American left is becoming increasingly credible.

title: European Commission dismisses interpreter over suspected espionage for Moscow
subhead: A translator present during a high-level, closed-door meeting with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky in late 2024 was caught taking notes – something that is strictly prohibited in this type of meeting.

title: Is the postcoital moment always a sad one?
subhead: Studies have shed light on 'postcoital dysphoria,' which can affect women and – even more frequently – men after sexual intercourse. This condition may manifest in the form of anxiety, sadness or even irritability.

title: 'On migration issues, we would like those in power to stick to the numbers, facts and science'
subhead: Another narrative must emerge in the face of hostility towards migrants, which has become an electoral issue, argues French former minister Najat Vallaud-Belkacem, who is now the head of a charity supporting asylum seekers.

title: Tax on ultra-rich: 'France has the opportunity to lead the way,' say Nobel Prize-winning economists
subhead: As public deficits balloon and extreme wealth explode, creating a minimum tax on the assets of billionaires should be a priority, argue seven Nobel Prize-winning economists in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: In Bhutan, yaks are in danger in the land of happiness
